divs: sighting detailsa group of us were walking across campus heading east when we noticed a bright orange-pink light coming towards us beneath the cloud bank.it was flying above the tree tops&was about the size of a golf ball traveling across the sky heading west.as we observed the starcraft it suddenly changed course&seemed to be descending just north of us.the unidentified craft was moving slow enough that we had a conversation trying to figure out what it could be.when it changed its direction&begin heading n\w.about 30seconds after the object changed course the bright glowing light went out,but we could still see the craft for a few seconds&then it disappeared-this was @8pm- about an hour later we found out that across campus at the same time of our sighting a couple, who were also out,observed this glowing salmon object,however their vantage point was better than ours.they saw the craft turn off the bright light after it changed direction to n\w,but they didn't lose sight of it.apparently the craft began to circle the university&surrounding area with its light off& when it arrived at the location where we first noticed the glowing object it turned on its salmon colored light again- as the light was turned back on it again cruised towards the western sky.after a couple of minutes cruising at a low altitude& speed it began heading n\w& the craft again turned its light off &disappeared for the second time-then there was a third pass following the same pattern & then it vanished-we have no idea what the object was or what the purpose of it's flight pattern-all five witnesses got together to try and figure out what we observed on the evening april 7th 2013,but we are at a loss as to what the identity of the craft was or what its purposed flight was doing above our heads-any information on the mysterious object would be greatly appreciated- -
